Class FlyWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • FlyWorld

  • public class FlyWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information about the world (i.e., the grid of squares)
    and handles most of the game play work that is NOT GUI specific

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlyWorld

        public FlyWorld(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reads a file containing information about
        the grid setup. Initializes the grid
        and other instance variables for use by
        FlyWorldGUI and other pieces of code.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file containing the world grid information

    • Method Detail

      • getNumRows

        public int getNumRows()
        Returns:
        int, the number of rows in the world

      • getNumCols

        public int getNumCols()

        public boolean isValidLoc(int r,

        a valid location in the world (i.e., it is not out of bounds)
        Parameters:
        r - a row
        c - a column
        Returns:
        boolean

        c - the column
        Returns:
        GridLocation

      • getFlyLocation

        public GridLocation getFlyLocation()
        Returns:
        FlyWorldLocation, the location of the fly in the world

      • moveFly

        public int moveFly(int direction)
        Moves the fly in the given direction (if possible) Checks if the fly got home or was eaten
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction, N,S,E,W to move
        Returns:
        int, determines the outcome of moving fly
        there are three possibilities
        1. fly is at home, return ATHOME (defined in FlyWorldGUI)
        2. fly is eaten, return EATEN (defined in FlyWorldGUI)
        3. fly not at home or eaten, return NOACTION (defined in FlyWorldGUI)

      • movePredators

        public boolean movePredators()
        Moves all predators. After it moves a predator, checks if it eats fly
        Returns:
        boolean, return true if any predator eats fly, false otherwise
